alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Frederick (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 3:36AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Maryland, including the following counties: Carroll and Frederick. * WHEN...Until 945 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 333 AM EST, The water level is expected to rise above flood stage along the Monocacy River around Bridgeport. Baptist Road near Bridgeport is expected to flood. The Monocacy may flow out of its banks elsewhere along the Frederick Carroll county line. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Emmitsburg... Keysville... Harney... Rocky Ridge... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
